You read news and article on a daily basis, so I will say you are a decent reader. But when you want to write, you need to write. You read daily, good. Now, write daily. Also, creativity is very close to imagination. When you have a vivid imagination, a knack for thinking out of the box, that’s when you can write creatively. So, here’s what you can do; Start reading novels. And majorly read fiction. Any fiction. It will make you familiar with thousands of styles of writing along with various mind boggling stories and plots.While you are at it, write and write. Write whenever you can and about whatever you can. I, being an engineering student, wrote about legal and entrepreneur stuff and I still do sometimes. Such contrast help me with my general knowledge as well as my writing skills.A creative writer needs to know how to tell a story. In short, write about stuff that you can explain deeply and in a manner that attracts everyone to it.Finally, make sure you have some honest and strict critics for your work. Whatever you are writing, show it to your friends or family or teachers. Whoever you feel will judge your content in a true unbiased way. Take their suggestions in a positive manner. Never, and I mean never ever get offended when someone is judging your content for you.You will learn as you write. Be creative in your imagination and it will come down on your paper automatically with a little patience and practice daily. So, all the best. Happy Writing! PS: Thanks for the A2A, User

You do not have to handle the pressure of being creative and out of the norms all the time. You can write about simple things which people do not pronounce out loud . Trust me when i say this , people tend to ignore simple things in life such as the beauty of a sunrise . If you write about it , they will come to notice it and realize what they have been missing on . So creativity is all about mentioning things , which people don’t . Go for it brother ! :)

Creative writing and content writing are two different styles completely in my opinion. For content writing, you have to be crisp and to informative, while creative writing gives you the luxury of spinning tales. A good way to conquer both would be to pick a neutral topic and write two sides to it. Say if you pick something like the current currency scenario: write an informative post as well as a story that revolves around the topic. Hope I helped :) Good luck!
